result.execSummary:
The defendant James G. COON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order Modifying the terms of recognizance bond:
1) the bail bond to be modified to allow for non-assaultive contact between James Coon and Jessica Coon;
2) the bail bond to be modified to allow James G. Coon to have non-assaultive contact with the residence at 1312 S. 19th Street, Manitowoc, WI.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Non-Monetary Conditions of Release; Affidavit of Jessica M. Coon.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 01-20-16 at 1:30 p.m.   Parties have an agreement to modify the no contact with Jessica Coon to no assaultive contact and to delete the residence.   
Minutes.

Prior: 12350 S. 23rd Street, Lot 1086, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Invocation of Right to Counsel; Cover Letter.
RE:  Sergio Escobar, on 12-06-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of endangering safety by use of dangerous weapon, recklessly endangering safety, disorderly conduct, and 2 counts criminal damage to property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-04-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $4,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol and have no contact with Sergio Escobar, DOB: 05-09-1976, Manuel Escobar, DOB: 12-04-1979, Jessica Coon, DOB: 01-25-1990 or the property at 1314 S. 19th Street, Manitowoc, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
